data: PED GI AMB Vedolizumab q8week for 6 month (Day of Treatment)
Admit/Transfer/Discharge
Discharge Patient
Discharge when IV is discontinued
Patient Care
Insert Peripheral IV (Intravenous) Catheter
T;N, Draw baseline blood work with IV start
Remove Peripheral IV Catheter
Remove 30 minute after administration of vedolizumab infusion if patient is stable
Notify Treating Provider Vital Signs
hypotension, arrhythmia, bronchospasm, angioedema, pruritus, urticaria, fever, chills or rigor or any other new acute discomfort or signs of allergic reaction
Communication Order
T;N, Ensure anaphylaxis kit is available
Medications
Pre Treatment Medications
acetaminophen
15 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: tab
diphenhydrAMINE
1 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: oral liq
1 mg/kg, PO, once, drug form: cap
diphenhydrAMINE
1 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
hydrocortisone
2 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
Biologic Agents
vedolizumab
6 mg/kg, IV, once, drug form: inj
300 mg, IV, once, drug form: inj
Adverse Reaction Management
acetaminophen
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: oral liq
15 mg/kg, PO, q6h, PRN other (see comment), drug form: tab
diphenhydrAMINE
1 mg/kg, IV, q4h, other (see comment), drug form: inj
hydrocortisone
1 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
2 mg/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), drug form: inj
epinephrine 1 mg/mL inj
0.01 mg/kg, IM, q5min, PRN anaphylaxis, order duration: 4 doses or times, drug form: inj
sodium chloride 0.9% (NS) bolus
10 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
10 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 15 minute, drug form: bag
20 mL/kg, IV, once, PRN other (see comment), administer over: 30 minute, drug form: bag
